summary: This is an affidavit filed by defense attorney Christian R. Everdell in the criminal case against Ghislaine Maxwell. It certifies that defense counsel has conferred with prosecutors regarding the disclosure of the identities of Victims 1-3 referenced in the indictment, but the government declined to provide them at this stage, stating it would do so through discovery or Jencks Act material closer to trial.

persons.name: Christian R. Everdell
persons.context: A partner at Cohen & Gresser LLP, serving as counsel for defendant Ghislaine Maxwell. He filed this affidavit certifying good faith conferral with prosecutors regarding disclosure of victim identities.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the criminal case (20 Cr. 330). The affidavit is filed by her defense counsel regarding discovery procedures related to victims in her indictment.

connections.description: Everdell is a defense attorney representing Maxwell in her criminal case, as stated in the affidavit.

events.title: Filing of Affidavit of Certification
events.description: Defense attorney Christian R. Everdell files an affidavit certifying that defense counsel has conferred with prosecutors regarding the disclosure of identities of Victims 1-3 from the indictment.

locations: UNITED STATES DISTRICT COURT SOUTHERN DISTRICT OF NEW YORK
keyFacts: Defense counsel for Ghislaine Maxwell requested the identities of Victims 1-3 referenced in the indictment.
The government did not agree to disclose the identities at this stage, stating it would do so through Rule 16 discovery or Jencks Act material closer to trial.
The affidavit certifies that defense counsel conferred in good faith with Assistant U.S. Attorneys regarding this request, as required by Local Criminal Rule 16.1.
